text: Edward James Martin "Ted" Koppel (born February 8, 1940) is a British-born American broadcast journalist. He is best known as the anchor for Nightline, from the program's beginning in 1980 until 2005. During his career, Koppel has won 25 Emmy Awards, including a Lifetime Achievement Award in 2007."Rebuilding the Future", The Philadelphia Inquirer, August 25, 2000 ==References== ==Other websites== * Biography from ABC * Ted Koppel to Join 'NY Times' Editorial Page, Contribute to NPR, a January 2006 article from Editor & Publisher * Global National anchor Kevin Newman recalls Ted Koppel on his blog * ABC News' "Time Tunnel" page containing clips of numerous newscasts (including Nightline) on which Koppel appeared * Memory and Imagination: New Pathways to the Library of Congress Documentary * Category:Emmy Award winners Category:1940 births Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American television presenters Category:American journalists
